abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column questions how Seattle Seahawks will recover from devastating loss to New England Patriots in the Super Bowl; holds coach Pete Carroll will have hard time rebuilding team's trust after disastrous call to pass at goal line.
lead_paragraph: The Patriots of Bill Belichick and Tom Brady always seem able to dig themselves out, but it will take a lot of work for the Seahawks to overcome such a devastating loss.

headline.main: Joy in Boston, and a Parade of Questions in Seattle
headline.seo: Patriots Celebrate Their Super Bowl Win as Seahawks Face a Long Winter
headline.print_headline: Joy in Boston, and a Parade of Questions in Seattle

snippet: The Patriots of Bill Belichick and Tom Brady always seem able to dig themselves out, but it will take a lot of work for the Seahawks to overcome such a devastating loss.
